listitem.para: ErrorStatus RTC_SetTime ( uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_TimeTypeDef * RTC_TimeStruct)
void RTC_GetTime ( uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_TimeTypeDef * RTC_TimeStruct)
ErrorStatus RTC_SetDate ( uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_DateTypeDef * RTC_DateStruct)
void RTC_GetDate ( uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_DateTypeDef * RTC_DateStruct)
void RTC_SetAlarm ( uint32_t RTC_Format, uint32_t RTC_Alarm, RTC_AlarmTypeDef * RTC_AlarmStruct)
void RTC_GetAlarm ( uint32_t RTC_Format, uint32_t RTC_Alarm, RTC_AlarmTypeDef * RTC_AlarmStruct)
ErrorStatus RTC_AlarmCmd ( uint32_t RTC_Alarm, FunctionalState NewState)
void RTC_AlarmSubSecondConfig ( uint32_t RTC_Alarm, uint32_t RTC_AlarmSubSecondValue, uint32_t RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask)
void RTC_DayLightSavingConfig ( uint32_t RTC_DayLightSaving, uint32_t RTC_StoreOperation)
void RTC_OutputConfig ( uint32_t RTC_Output, uint32_t RTC_OutputPolarity)
ErrorStatus RTC_CoarseCalibConfig ( uint32_t RTC_CalibSign, uint32_t Value)
ErrorStatus RTC_SmoothCalibConfig ( uint32_t RTC_SmoothCalibPeriod, uint32_t RTC_SmoothCalibPlusPulses, uint32_t RTC_SmouthCalibMinusPulsesValue)
void RTC_TimeStampCmd ( uint32_t RTC_TimeStampEdge, FunctionalState NewState)
void RTC_GetTimeStamp ( uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_TimeTypeDef * RTC_StampTimeStruct, RTC_DateTypeDef * RTC_StampDateStruct)
void RTC_TamperTriggerConfig ( uint32_t RTC_Tamper, uint32_t RTC_TamperTrigger)
void RTC_TamperCmd ( uint32_t RTC_Tamper, FunctionalState NewState)
void RTC_WriteBackupRegister ( uint32_t RTC_BKP_DR, uint32_t Data)
ErrorStatus RTC_SynchroShiftConfig ( uint32_t RTC_ShiftAdd1S, uint32_t RTC_ShiftSubFS)
void RTC_ITConfig ( uint32_t RTC_IT, FunctionalState NewState)

#define RTC_FLAGS_MASK ((uint32_t)(RTC_FLAG_TSOVF | RTC_FLAG_TSF | RTC_FLAG_WUTF | \ RTC_FLAG_ALRBF | RTC_FLAG_ALRAF | RTC_FLAG_INITF | \ RTC_FLAG_RSF | RTC_FLAG_INITS | RTC_FLAG_WUTWF | \ RTC_FLAG_ALRBWF | RTC_FLAG_ALRAWF | RTC_FLAG_TAMP1F ))

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_DeInit (void)
section.emphasis: Deinitializes the RTC registers to their default reset values.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function doesn't reset the RTC Clock source and RTC Backup Data registers.

entry.para:
ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC registers are deinitialized
ERROR: RTC registers are not deinitialized

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_Init (RTC_InitTypeDef *RTC_InitStruct)
section.emphasis: Initializes the RTC registers according to the specified parameters in RTC_InitStruct.

entry.para: pointer to a RTC_InitTypeDef structure that contains the configuration information for the RTC peripheral.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The RTC Prescaler register is write protected and can be written in initialization mode only.

entry.para:
ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC registers are initialized
ERROR: RTC registers are not initialized

section.title: void RTC_StructInit (RTC_InitTypeDef *RTC_InitStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each RTC_InitStruct member with its default value.

entry.para: pointer to a RTC_InitTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void RTC_WriteProtectionCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the RTC registers write protection.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: All the RTC registers are write protected except for RTC_ISR[13:8], RTC_TAFCR and RTC_BKPxR.
Writing a wrong key reactivates the write protection.
The protection mechanism is not affected by system reset.

entry.para: new state of the write protection. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_EnterInitMode (void)
section.emphasis: Enters the RTC Initialization mode.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The RTC Initialization mode is write protected, use the RTC_WriteProtectionCmd(DISABLE) before calling this function.

entry.para:
ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC is in Init mode
ERROR: RTC is not in Init mode

section.title: void RTC_ExitInitMode (void)
section.emphasis: Exits the RTC Initialization mode.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: When the initialization sequence is complete, the calendar restarts counting after 4 RTCCLK cycles.
The RTC Initialization mode is write protected, use the RTC_WriteProtectionCmd(DISABLE) before calling this function.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_WaitForSynchro (void)
section.emphasis: Waits until the RTC Time and Date registers (RTC_TR and RTC_DR) are synchronized with RTC APB clock.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The RTC Resynchronization mode is write protected, use the RTC_WriteProtectionCmd(DISABLE) before calling this function.

To read the calendar through the shadow registers after Calendar initialization, calendar update or after wakeup from low power modes the software must first clear the RSF flag. The software must then wait until it is set again before reading the calendar, which means that the calendar registers have been correctly copied into the RTC_TR and RTC_DR shadow registers.

entry.para:
ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC registers are synchronised
ERROR: RTC registers are not synchronised

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_RefClockCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the RTC reference clock detection.

entry.para: new state of the RTC reference clock. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC reference clock detection is enabled
ERROR: RTC reference clock detection is disabled

section.title: void RTC_BypassShadowCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the Bypass Shadow feature.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: When the Bypass Shadow is enabled the calendar value are taken directly from the Calendar counter.

entry.para: new state of the Bypass Shadow feature. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_SetTime (uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_TimeTypeDef *RTC_TimeStruct)
section.emphasis: Set the RTC current time.

entry.para:
specifies the format of the entered parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format
pointer to a RTC_TimeTypeDef structure that contains the time configuration information for the RTC.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Time register is configured
ERROR: RTC Time register is not configured

section.title: void RTC_TimeStructInit (RTC_TimeTypeDef *RTC_TimeStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each RTC_TimeStruct member with its default value (Time = 00h:00min:00sec).

entry.para: pointer to a RTC_TimeTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void RTC_GetTime (uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_TimeTypeDef *RTC_TimeStruct)
section.emphasis: Get the RTC current Time.

entry.para:
specifies the format of the returned parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format
pointer to a RTC_TimeTypeDef structure that will contain the returned current time configuration.

section.title: uint32_t RTC_GetSubSecond (void)
section.emphasis: Gets the RTC current Calendar Subseconds value.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function freeze the Time and Date registers after reading the SSR register.

entry.para: current Calendar Subseconds value.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_SetDate (uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_DateTypeDef *RTC_DateStruct)
section.emphasis: Set the RTC current date.

entry.para:
specifies the format of the entered parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format
pointer to a RTC_DateTypeDef structure that contains the date configuration information for the RTC.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Date register is configured
ERROR: RTC Date register is not configured

section.title: void RTC_DateStructInit (RTC_DateTypeDef *RTC_DateStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each RTC_DateStruct member with its default value (Monday, January 01 xx00).

entry.para: pointer to a RTC_DateTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void RTC_GetDate (uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_DateTypeDef *RTC_DateStruct)
section.emphasis: Get the RTC current date.

entry.para:
specifies the format of the returned parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format
pointer to a RTC_DateTypeDef structure that will contain the returned current date configuration.

section.title: void RTC_SetAlarm (uint32_t RTC_Format, uint32_t RTC_Alarm, RTC_AlarmTypeDef *RTC_AlarmStruct)
section.emphasis: Set the specified RTC Alarm.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The Alarm register can only be written when the corresponding Alarm is disabled (Use the RTC_AlarmCmd(DISABLE)).

entry.para:
specifies the format of the returned parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format

specifies the alarm to be configured. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Alarm_A: to select Alarm A
RTC_Alarm_B: to select Alarm B
pointer to a RTC_AlarmTypeDef structure that contains the alarm configuration parameters.

section.title: void RTC_AlarmStructInit (RTC_AlarmTypeDef *RTC_AlarmStruct)
section.emphasis: Fills each RTC_AlarmStruct member with its default value (Time = 00h:00mn:00sec / Date = 1st day of the month/Mask = all fields are masked).

entry.para: pointer to a RTC_AlarmTypeDef structure which will be initialized.

section.title: void RTC_GetAlarm (uint32_t RTC_Format, uint32_t RTC_Alarm, RTC_AlarmTypeDef *RTC_AlarmStruct)
section.emphasis: Get the RTC Alarm value and masks.

entry.para:
specifies the format of the output parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format

specifies the alarm to be read. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Alarm_A: to select Alarm A
RTC_Alarm_B: to select Alarm B
pointer to a RTC_AlarmTypeDef structure that will contains the output alarm configuration values.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_AlarmCmd (uint32_t RTC_Alarm, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified RTC Alarm.

entry.para:
specifies the alarm to be configured. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
RTC_Alarm_A: to select Alarm A
RTC_Alarm_B: to select Alarm B
new state of the specified alarm. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Alarm is enabled/disabled
ERROR: RTC Alarm is not enabled/disabled

section.title: void RTC_AlarmSubSecondConfig (uint32_t RTC_Alarm, uint32_t RTC_AlarmSubSecondValue, uint32_t RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask)
section.emphasis: Configure the RTC AlarmA/B Subseconds value and mask.*.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This function is performed only when the Alarm is disabled.

entry.para:
specifies the alarm to be configured. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Alarm_A: to select Alarm A
RTC_Alarm_B: to select Alarm B
specifies the Subseconds value. This parameter can be a value from 0 to 0x00007FFF.

specifies the Subseconds Mask. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_All : All Alarm SS fields are masked. There is no comparison on sub seconds for Alarm.
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_1 : SS[14:1] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[0] is compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_2 : SS[14:2] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[1:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_3 : SS[14:3] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[2:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_4 : SS[14:4] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[3:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_5 : SS[14:5] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[4:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_6 : SS[14:6] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[5:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_7 : SS[14:7] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[6:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_8 : SS[14:8] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[7:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_9 : SS[14:9] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[8:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_10: SS[14:10] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[9:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_11: SS[14:11] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[10:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_12: SS[14:12] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[11:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14_13: SS[14:13] are don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[12:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_SS14 : SS[14] is don't care in Alarm comparison. Only SS[13:0] are compared
RTC_AlarmSubSecondMask_None : SS[14:0] are compared and must match to activate alarm

section.title: uint32_t RTC_GetAlarmSubSecond (uint32_t RTC_Alarm)
section.emphasis: Gets the RTC Alarm Subseconds value.

entry.para:
specifies the alarm to be read. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Alarm_A: to select Alarm A
RTC_Alarm_B: to select Alarm B
Alarm Subseconds value.

section.title: void RTC_WakeUpClockConfig (uint32_t RTC_WakeUpClock)
section.emphasis: Configures the RTC Wakeup clock source.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The WakeUp Clock source can only be changed when the RTC WakeUp is disabled (Use the RTC_WakeUpCmd(DISABLE)).

entry.para:
Wakeup Clock source. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_WakeUpClock_RTCCLK_Div16: RTC Wakeup Counter Clock = RTCCLK/16
RTC_WakeUpClock_RTCCLK_Div8: RTC Wakeup Counter Clock = RTCCLK/8
RTC_WakeUpClock_RTCCLK_Div4: RTC Wakeup Counter Clock = RTCCLK/4
RTC_WakeUpClock_RTCCLK_Div2: RTC Wakeup Counter Clock = RTCCLK/2
RTC_WakeUpClock_CK_SPRE_16bits: RTC Wakeup Counter Clock = CK_SPRE
RTC_WakeUpClock_CK_SPRE_17bits: RTC Wakeup Counter Clock = CK_SPRE

section.title: void RTC_SetWakeUpCounter (uint32_t RTC_WakeUpCounter)
section.emphasis: Configures the RTC Wakeup counter.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The RTC WakeUp counter can only be written when the RTC WakeUp is disabled (Use the RTC_WakeUpCmd(DISABLE)).

entry.para: specifies the WakeUp counter. This parameter can be a value from 0x0000 to 0xFFFF.

section.title: uint32_t RTC_GetWakeUpCounter (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the RTC WakeUp timer counter value.

entry.para: RTC WakeUp Counter value.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_WakeUpCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the RTC WakeUp timer.

entry.para: new state of the WakeUp timer. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void RTC_DayLightSavingConfig (uint32_t RTC_DayLightSaving, uint32_t RTC_StoreOperation)
section.emphasis: Adds or substract one hour from the current time.

entry.para:
the value of hour adjustment. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_DayLightSaving_SUB1H: Substract one hour (winter time)
RTC_DayLightSaving_ADD1H: Add one hour (summer time)

Specifies the value to be written in the BCK bit in CR register to store the operation. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_StoreOperation_Reset: BCK Bit Reset
RTC_StoreOperation_Set: BCK Bit Set

section.title: uint32_t RTC_GetStoreOperation (void)
section.emphasis: Returns the RTC Day Light Saving stored operation.

entry.para:
Day Light Saving stored operation.
RTC_StoreOperation_Reset
RTC_StoreOperation_Set

section.title: void RTC_OutputConfig (uint32_t RTC_Output, uint32_t RTC_OutputPolarity)
section.emphasis: Configures the RTC output source (AFO_ALARM).

entry.para:
Specifies which signal will be routed to the RTC output. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Output_Disable: No output selected
RTC_Output_AlarmA: signal of AlarmA mapped to output
RTC_Output_AlarmB: signal of AlarmB mapped to output
RTC_Output_WakeUp: signal of WakeUp mapped to output

Specifies the polarity of the output signal. This parameter can be one of the following:
RTC_OutputPolarity_High: The output pin is high when the ALRAF/ALRBF/WUTF is high (depending on OSEL)
RTC_OutputPolarity_Low: The output pin is low when the ALRAF/ALRBF/WUTF is high (depending on OSEL)

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_CoarseCalibConfig (uint32_t RTC_CalibSign, uint32_t Value)
section.emphasis: Configures the Coarse calibration parameters.

entry.para:
specifies the sign of the coarse calibration value. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_CalibSign_Positive: The value sign is positive
RTC_CalibSign_Negative: The value sign is negative
value of coarse calibration expressed in ppm (coded on 5 bits).

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: This Calibration value should be between 0 and 63 when using negative sign with a 2-ppm step.
This Calibration value should be between 0 and 126 when using positive sign with a 4-ppm step.

entry.para:
ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Coarse calibration are initialized
ERROR: RTC Coarse calibration are not initialized

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_CoarseCalibCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the Coarse calibration process.

entry.para: new state of the Coarse calibration. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Coarse calibration are enabled/disabled
ERROR: RTC Coarse calibration are not enabled/disabled

section.title: void RTC_CalibOutputCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the RTC clock to be output through the relative pin.

entry.para: new state of the digital calibration Output. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void RTC_CalibOutputConfig (uint32_t RTC_CalibOutput)
section.emphasis: Configure the Calibration Pinout (RTC_CALIB) Selection (1Hz or 512Hz).

entry.para:
: Select the Calibration output Selection . This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_CalibOutput_512Hz: A signal has a regular waveform at 512Hz.
RTC_CalibOutput_1Hz : A signal has a regular waveform at 1Hz.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_SmoothCalibConfig (uint32_t RTC_SmoothCalibPeriod, uint32_t RTC_SmoothCalibPlusPulses, uint32_t RTC_SmouthCalibMinusPulsesValue)
section.emphasis: Configures the Smooth Calibration Settings.

entry.para:
: Select the Smooth Calibration Period. This parameter can be can be one of the following values:
RTC_SmoothCalibPeriod_32sec : The smooth calibration periode is 32s.
RTC_SmoothCalibPeriod_16sec : The smooth calibration periode is 16s.
RTC_SmoothCalibPeriod_8sec : The smooth calibartion periode is 8s.

: Select to Set or reset the CALP bit. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_SmoothCalibPlusPulses_Set : Add one RTCCLK puls every 2**11 pulses.
RTC_SmoothCalibPlusPulses_Reset: No RTCCLK pulses are added.
Select the value of CALM[8:0] bits. This parameter can be one any value from 0 to 0x000001FF.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Calib registers are configured
ERROR: RTC Calib registers are not configured

section.title: void RTC_TimeStampCmd (uint32_t RTC_TimeStampEdge, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the RTC TimeStamp functionality with the specified time stamp pin stimulating edge.

entry.para:
Specifies the pin edge on which the TimeStamp is activated. This parameter can be one of the following:
RTC_TimeStampEdge_Rising: the Time stamp event occurs on the rising edge of the related pin.
RTC_TimeStampEdge_Falling: the Time stamp event occurs on the falling edge of the related pin.
new state of the TimeStamp. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void RTC_GetTimeStamp (uint32_t RTC_Format, RTC_TimeTypeDef *RTC_StampTimeStruct, RTC_DateTypeDef *RTC_StampDateStruct)
section.emphasis: Get the RTC TimeStamp value and masks.

entry.para:
specifies the format of the output parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_Format_BIN: Binary data format
RTC_Format_BCD: BCD data format
pointer to a RTC_TimeTypeDef structure that will contains the TimeStamp time values.
pointer to a RTC_DateTypeDef structure that will contains the TimeStamp date values.

section.title: uint32_t RTC_GetTimeStampSubSecond (void)
section.emphasis: Get the RTC timestamp Subseconds value.

entry.para: current timestamp Subseconds value.

section.title: void RTC_TamperTriggerConfig (uint32_t RTC_Tamper, uint32_t RTC_TamperTrigger)
section.emphasis: Configures the select Tamper pin edge.

entry.para: Selected tamper pin. This parameter can be RTC_Tamper_1.

Specifies the trigger on the tamper pin that stimulates tamper event. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_TamperTrigger_RisingEdge: Rising Edge of the tamper pin causes tamper event.
RTC_TamperTrigger_FallingEdge: Falling Edge of the tamper pin causes tamper event.
RTC_TamperTrigger_LowLevel: Low Level of the tamper pin causes tamper event.
RTC_TamperTrigger_HighLevel: High Level of the tamper pin causes tamper event.

section.title: void RTC_TamperCmd (uint32_t RTC_Tamper, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the Tamper detection.

entry.para: Selected tamper pin. This parameter can be RTC_Tamper_1.
new state of the tamper pin. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void RTC_TamperFilterConfig (uint32_t RTC_TamperFilter)
section.emphasis: Configures the Tampers Filter.

entry.para:
Specifies the tampers filter. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_TamperFilter_Disable: Tamper filter is disabled.
RTC_TamperFilter_2Sample: Tamper is activated after 2 consecutive samples at the active level
RTC_TamperFilter_4Sample: Tamper is activated after 4 consecutive samples at the active level
RTC_TamperFilter_8Sample: Tamper is activated after 8 consecutive samples at the active level

section.title: void RTC_TamperSamplingFreqConfig (uint32_t RTC_TamperSamplingFreq)
section.emphasis: Configures the Tampers Sampling Frequency.

entry.para:
Specifies the tampers Sampling Frequency. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div32768: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 32768
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div16384: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 16384
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div8192: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 8192
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div4096: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 4096
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div2048: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 2048
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div1024: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 1024
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div512: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 512
RTC_TamperSamplingFreq_RTCCLK_Div256: Each of the tamper inputs are sampled with a frequency = RTCCLK / 256

section.title: void RTC_TamperPinsPrechargeDuration (uint32_t RTC_TamperPrechargeDuration)
section.emphasis: Configures the Tampers Pins input Precharge Duration.

entry.para:
Specifies the Tampers Pins input Precharge Duration. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_TamperPrechargeDuration_1RTCCLK: Tamper pins are pre-charged before sampling during 1 RTCCLK cycle
RTC_TamperPrechargeDuration_2RTCCLK: Tamper pins are pre-charged before sampling during 2 RTCCLK cycle
RTC_TamperPrechargeDuration_4RTCCLK: Tamper pins are pre-charged before sampling during 4 RTCCLK cycle
RTC_TamperPrechargeDuration_8RTCCLK: Tamper pins are pre-charged before sampling during 8 RTCCLK cycle

section.title: void RTC_TimeStampOnTamperDetectionCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the TimeStamp on Tamper Detection Event.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: The timestamp is valid even the TSE bit in tamper control register is reset.

entry.para: new state of the timestamp on tamper event. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void RTC_TamperPullUpCmd (FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or Disables the Precharge of Tamper pin.

entry.para: new state of tamper pull up. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: void RTC_WriteBackupRegister (uint32_t RTC_BKP_DR, uint32_t Data)
section.emphasis: Writes a data in a specified RTC Backup data register.

entry.para: RTC Backup data Register number. This parameter can be: RTC_BKP_DRx where x can be from 0 to 19 to specify the register.
Data to be written in the specified RTC Backup data register.

section.title: uint32_t RTC_ReadBackupRegister (uint32_t RTC_BKP_DR)
section.emphasis: Reads data from the specified RTC Backup data Register.

entry.para: RTC Backup data Register number. This parameter can be: RTC_BKP_DRx where x can be from 0 to 19 to specify the register.

section.title: void RTC_TamperPinSelection (uint32_t RTC_TamperPin)
section.emphasis: Selects the RTC Tamper Pin.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC Tamper Pin. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_TamperPin_PC13: PC13 is selected as RTC Tamper Pin.
RTC_TamperPin_PI8: PI8 is selected as RTC Tamper Pin.

section.title: void RTC_TimeStampPinSelection (uint32_t RTC_TimeStampPin)
section.emphasis: Selects the RTC TimeStamp Pin.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC TimeStamp Pin. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_TimeStampPin_PC13: PC13 is selected as RTC TimeStamp Pin.
RTC_TimeStampPin_PI8: PI8 is selected as RTC TimeStamp Pin.

section.title: void RTC_OutputTypeConfig (uint32_t RTC_OutputType)
section.emphasis: Configures the RTC Output Pin mode.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC Output (PC13) pin mode. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_OutputType_OpenDrain: RTC Output (PC13) is configured in Open Drain mode.
RTC_OutputType_PushPull: RTC Output (PC13) is configured in Push Pull mode.

section.title: ErrorStatus RTC_SynchroShiftConfig (uint32_t RTC_ShiftAdd1S, uint32_t RTC_ShiftSubFS)
section.emphasis: Configures the Synchronization Shift Control Settings.

formalpara.title: Note:
formalpara.para: When REFCKON is set, firmware must not write to Shift control register

entry.para:
: Select to add or not 1 second to the time Calendar. This parameter can be one of the following values :
RTC_ShiftAdd1S_Set : Add one second to the clock calendar.
RTC_ShiftAdd1S_Reset: No effect.
Select the number of Second Fractions to Substitute. This parameter can be one any value from 0 to 0x7FFF.

ErrorStatus enumeration value:
SUCCESS: RTC Shift registers are configured
ERROR: RTC Shift registers are not configured

section.title: void RTC_ITConfig (uint32_t RTC_IT, FunctionalState NewState)
section.emphasis: Enables or disables the specified RTC interrupts.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC interrupt sources to be enabled or disabled. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
RTC_IT_TS: Time Stamp interrupt mask
RTC_IT_WUT: WakeUp Timer interrupt mask
RTC_IT_ALRB: Alarm B interrupt mask
RTC_IT_ALRA: Alarm A interrupt mask
RTC_IT_TAMP: Tamper event interrupt mask
new state of the specified RTC interrupts. This parameter can be: ENABLE or DISABLE.

section.title: FlagStatus RTC_GetFlagStatus (uint32_t RTC_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified RTC flag is set or not.

entry.para:
specifies the flag to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_FLAG_TAMP1F: Tamper 1 event flag
RTC_FLAG_TSOVF: Time Stamp OverFlow flag
RTC_FLAG_TSF: Time Stamp event flag
RTC_FLAG_WUTF: WakeUp Timer flag
RTC_FLAG_ALRBF: Alarm B flag
RTC_FLAG_ALRAF: Alarm A flag
RTC_FLAG_INITF: Initialization mode flag
RTC_FLAG_RSF: Registers Synchronized flag
RTC_FLAG_INITS: Registers Configured flag
RTC_FLAG_WUTWF: WakeUp Timer Write flag
RTC_FLAG_ALRBWF: Alarm B Write flag
RTC_FLAG_ALRAWF: Alarm A write flag
new state of RTC_FLAG (SET or RESET).

section.title: void RTC_ClearFlag (uint32_t RTC_FLAG)
section.emphasis: Clears the RTC's pending flags.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC flag to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
RTC_FLAG_TAMP1F: Tamper 1 event flag
RTC_FLAG_TSOVF: Time Stamp Overflow flag
RTC_FLAG_TSF: Time Stamp event flag
RTC_FLAG_WUTF: WakeUp Timer flag
RTC_FLAG_ALRBF: Alarm B flag
RTC_FLAG_ALRAF: Alarm A flag
RTC_FLAG_RSF: Registers Synchronized flag

section.title: ITStatus RTC_GetITStatus (uint32_t RTC_IT)
section.emphasis: Checks whether the specified RTC interrupt has occurred or not.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC interrupt source to check. This parameter can be one of the following values:
RTC_IT_TS: Time Stamp interrupt
RTC_IT_WUT: WakeUp Timer interrupt
RTC_IT_ALRB: Alarm B interrupt
RTC_IT_ALRA: Alarm A interrupt
RTC_IT_TAMP1: Tamper 1 event interrupt
new state of RTC_IT (SET or RESET).

section.title: void RTC_ClearITPendingBit (uint32_t RTC_IT)
section.emphasis: Clears the RTC's interrupt pending bits.

entry.para:
specifies the RTC interrupt pending bit to clear. This parameter can be any combination of the following values:
RTC_IT_TS: Time Stamp interrupt
RTC_IT_WUT: WakeUp Timer interrupt
RTC_IT_ALRB: Alarm B interrupt
RTC_IT_ALRA: Alarm A interrupt
RTC_IT_TAMP1: Tamper 1 event interrupt
